speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: ACT I

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: SCENE I. KING JOHN'S palace.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Enter KING JOHN, QUEEN ELINOR, PEMBROKE, ESSEX, SALISBURY, and others, with CHATILLON

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Now, say, Chatillon, what would France with us?

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Thus, after greeting, speaks the King of France

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: In my behavior to the majesty,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: The borrow'd majesty, of England here.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: A strange beginning: 'borrow'd majesty!'

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Silence, good mother; hear the embassy.

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Philip of France, in right and true behalf

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Of thy deceased brother Geffrey's son,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Arthur Plantagenet, lays most lawful claim

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: To this fair island and the territories,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: To Ireland, Poictiers, Anjou, Touraine, Maine,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Desiring thee to lay aside the sword

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Which sways usurpingly these several titles,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: And put these same into young Arthur's hand,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Thy nephew and right royal sovereign.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What follows if we disallow of this?

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: The proud control of fierce and bloody war,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: To enforce these rights so forcibly withheld.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Here have we war for war and blood for blood,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Controlment for controlment: so answer France.

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: Then take my king's defiance from my mouth,

speaker: CHATILLON
text_entry: The farthest limit of my embassy.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Bear mine to him, and so depart in peace:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Be thou as lightning in the eyes of France;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: For ere thou canst report I will be there,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The thunder of my cannon shall be heard:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: So hence! Be thou the trumpet of our wrath

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And sullen presage of your own decay.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: An honourable conduct let him have:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Pembroke, look to 't. Farewell, Chatillon.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Exeunt CHATILLON and PEMBROKE

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: What now, my son! have I not ever said

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: How that ambitious Constance would not cease

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Till she had kindled France and all the world,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Upon the right and party of her son?

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: This might have been prevented and made whole

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: With very easy arguments of love,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Which now the manage of two kingdoms must

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: With fearful bloody issue arbitrate.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Our strong possession and our right for us.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Your strong possession much more than your right,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Or else it must go wrong with you and me:

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: So much my conscience whispers in your ear,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Which none but heaven and you and I shall hear.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Enter a Sheriff

speaker: ESSEX
text_entry: My liege, here is the strangest controversy

speaker: ESSEX
text_entry: Come from country to be judged by you,

speaker: ESSEX
text_entry: That e'er I heard: shall I produce the men?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Let them approach.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Our abbeys and our priories shall pay

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: This expedition's charge.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enter ROBERT and the BASTARD

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What men are you?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your faithful subject I, a gentleman

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Born in Northamptonshire and eldest son,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As I suppose, to Robert Faulconbridge,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: A soldier, by the honour-giving hand

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Of Coeur-de-lion knighted in the field.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What art thou?

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: The son and heir to that same Faulconbridge.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Is that the elder, and art thou the heir?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: You came not of one mother then, it seems.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Most certain of one mother, mighty king;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That is well known; and, as I think, one father:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But for the certain knowledge of that truth

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I put you o'er to heaven and to my mother:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Of that I doubt, as all men's children may.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Out on thee, rude man! thou dost shame thy mother

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: And wound her honour with this diffidence.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I, madam? no, I have no reason for it;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That is my brother's plea and none of mine;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The which if he can prove, a' pops me out

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: At least from fair five hundred pound a year:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Heaven guard my mother's honour and my land!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: A good blunt fellow. Why, being younger born,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Doth he lay claim to thine inheritance?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I know not why, except to get the land.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But once he slander'd me with bastardy:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But whether I be as true begot or no,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That still I lay upon my mother's head,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But that I am as well begot, my liege,--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Fair fall the bones that took the pains for me!--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Compare our faces and be judge yourself.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: If old sir Robert did beget us both

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And were our father and this son like him,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O old sir Robert, father, on my knee

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I give heaven thanks I was not like to thee!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Why, what a madcap hath heaven lent us here!

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: He hath a trick of Coeur-de-lion's face;

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: The accent of his tongue affecteth him.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Do you not read some tokens of my son

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: In the large composition of this man?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Mine eye hath well examined his parts

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And finds them perfect Richard. Sirrah, speak,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What doth move you to claim your brother's land?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Because he hath a half-face, like my father.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: With half that face would he have all my land:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: A half-faced groat five hundred pound a year!

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: My gracious liege, when that my father lived,

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Your brother did employ my father much,--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Well, sir, by this you cannot get my land:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your tale must be how he employ'd my mother.

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: And once dispatch'd him in an embassy

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: To Germany, there with the emperor

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: To treat of high affairs touching that time.

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: The advantage of his absence took the king

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: And in the mean time sojourn'd at my father's;

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Where how he did prevail I shame to speak,

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: But truth is truth: large lengths of seas and shores

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Between my father and my mother lay,

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: As I have heard my father speak himself,

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: When this same lusty gentleman was got.

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Upon his death-bed he by will bequeath'd

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: His lands to me, and took it on his death

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: That this my mother's son was none of his;

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: And if he were, he came into the world

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Full fourteen weeks before the course of time.

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Then, good my liege, let me have what is mine,

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: My father's land, as was my father's will.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Sirrah, your brother is legitimate;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Your father's wife did after wedlock bear him,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And if she did play false, the fault was hers;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Which fault lies on the hazards of all husbands

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: That marry wives. Tell me, how if my brother,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Who, as you say, took pains to get this son,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Had of your father claim'd this son for his?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: In sooth, good friend, your father might have kept

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: This calf bred from his cow from all the world;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: In sooth he might; then, if he were my brother's,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: My brother might not claim him; nor your father,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Being none of his, refuse him: this concludes;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: My mother's son did get your father's heir;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Your father's heir must have your father's land.

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: Shall then my father's will be of no force

speaker: ROBERT
text_entry: To dispossess that child which is not his?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Of no more force to dispossess me, sir,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Than was his will to get me, as I think.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Whether hadst thou rather be a Faulconbridge

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: And like thy brother, to enjoy thy land,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Or the reputed son of Coeur-de-lion,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Lord of thy presence and no land beside?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Madam, an if my brother had my shape,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And I had his, sir Robert's his, like him;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And if my legs were two such riding-rods,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: My arms such eel-skins stuff'd, my face so thin

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That in mine ear I durst not stick a rose

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Lest men should say 'Look, where three-farthings goes!'

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And, to his shape, were heir to all this land,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Would I might never stir from off this place,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I would give it every foot to have this face;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I would not be sir Nob in any case.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: I like thee well: wilt thou forsake thy fortune,

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Bequeath thy land to him and follow me?

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: I am a soldier and now bound to France.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Brother, take you my land, I'll take my chance.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your face hath got five hundred pound a year,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Yet sell your face for five pence and 'tis dear.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Madam, I'll follow you unto the death.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Nay, I would have you go before me thither.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Our country manners give our betters way.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What is thy name?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Philip, my liege, so is my name begun,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Philip, good old sir Robert's wife's eldest son.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: From henceforth bear his name whose form thou bear'st:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Kneel thou down Philip, but rise more great,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Arise sir Richard and Plantagenet.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Brother by the mother's side, give me your hand:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: My father gave me honour, yours gave land.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Now blessed by the hour, by night or day,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: When I was got, sir Robert was away!

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: The very spirit of Plantagenet!

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: I am thy grandam, Richard; call me so.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Madam, by chance but not by truth; what though?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Something about, a little from the right,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: In at the window, or else o'er the hatch:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Who dares not stir by day must walk by night,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And have is have, however men do catch:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Near or far off, well won is still well shot,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And I am I, howe'er I was begot.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Go, Faulconbridge: now hast thou thy desire;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: A landless knight makes thee a landed squire.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Come, madam, and come, Richard, we must speed

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: For France, for France, for it is more than need.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Brother, adieu: good fortune come to thee!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For thou wast got i' the way of honesty.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exeunt all but BASTARD

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: A foot of honour better than I was;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But many a many foot of land the worse.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Well, now can I make any Joan a lady.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'Good den, sir Richard!'--'God-a-mercy, fellow!'--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And if his name be George, I'll call him Peter;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For new-made honour doth forget men's names;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'Tis too respective and too sociable

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For your conversion. Now your traveller,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: He and his toothpick at my worship's mess,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And when my knightly stomach is sufficed,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Why then I suck my teeth and catechise

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: My picked man of countries: 'My dear sir,'

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Thus, leaning on mine elbow, I begin,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'I shall beseech you'--that is question now;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And then comes answer like an Absey book:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'O sir,' says answer, 'at your best command;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: At your employment; at your service, sir;'

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'No, sir,' says question, 'I, sweet sir, at yours:'

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And so, ere answer knows what question would,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Saving in dialogue of compliment,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And talking of the Alps and Apennines,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The Pyrenean and the river Po,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: It draws toward supper in conclusion so.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But this is worshipful society

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And fits the mounting spirit like myself,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For he is but a bastard to the time

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That doth not smack of observation;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And so am I, whether I smack or no;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And not alone in habit and device,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exterior form, outward accoutrement,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But from the inward motion to deliver

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sweet, sweet, sweet poison for the age's tooth:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Which, though I will not practise to deceive,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Yet, to avoid deceit, I mean to learn;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For it shall strew the footsteps of my rising.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But who comes in such haste in riding-robes?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: What woman-post is this? hath she no husband

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That will take pains to blow a horn before her?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Enter LADY FAULCONBRIDGE and GURNEY

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O me! it is my mother. How now, good lady!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: What brings you here to court so hastily?

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Where is that slave, thy brother? where is he,

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: That holds in chase mine honour up and down?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: My brother Robert? old sir Robert's son?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Colbrand the giant, that same mighty man?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Is it sir Robert's son that you seek so?

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Sir Robert's son! Ay, thou unreverend boy,

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Sir Robert's son: why scorn'st thou at sir Robert?

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: He is sir Robert's son, and so art thou.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: James Gurney, wilt thou give us leave awhile?

speaker: GURNEY
text_entry: Good leave, good Philip.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Philip! sparrow: James,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: There's toys abroad: anon I'll tell thee more.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exit GURNEY

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Madam, I was not old sir Robert's son:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sir Robert might have eat his part in me

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Upon Good-Friday and ne'er broke his fast:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sir Robert could do well: marry, to confess,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Could he get me? Sir Robert could not do it:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: We know his handiwork: therefore, good mother,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To whom am I beholding for these limbs?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sir Robert never holp to make this leg.

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Hast thou conspired with thy brother too,

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: That for thine own gain shouldst defend mine honour?

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: What means this scorn, thou most untoward knave?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Knight, knight, good mother, Basilisco-like.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: What! I am dubb'd! I have it on my shoulder.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But, mother, I am not sir Robert's son;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I have disclaim'd sir Robert and my land;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Legitimation, name and all is gone:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Then, good my mother, let me know my father;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Some proper man, I hope: who was it, mother?

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Hast thou denied thyself a Faulconbridge?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As faithfully as I deny the devil.

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: King Richard Coeur-de-lion was thy father:

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: By long and vehement suit I was seduced

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: To make room for him in my husband's bed:

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Heaven lay not my transgression to my charge!

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Thou art the issue of my dear offence,

speaker: LADY FAULCONBRIDGE
text_entry: Which was so strongly urged past my defence.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Now, by this light, were I to get again,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Madam, I would not wish a better father.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Some sins do bear their privilege on earth,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And so doth yours; your fault was not your folly:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Needs must you lay your heart at his dispose,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Subjected tribute to commanding love,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Against whose fury and unmatched force

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The aweless lion could not wage the fight,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Nor keep his princely heart from Richard's hand.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: He that perforce robs lions of their hearts

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: May easily win a woman's. Ay, my mother,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: With all my heart I thank thee for my father!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Who lives and dares but say thou didst not well

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: When I was got, I'll send his soul to hell.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Come, lady, I will show thee to my kin;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And they shall say, when Richard me begot,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: If thou hadst said him nay, it had been sin:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Who says it was, he lies; I say 'twas not.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: ACT II

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: SCENE I. France. Before Angiers.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Enter AUSTRIA and forces, drums, etc. on one side:  on the other KING PHILIP and his power; LEWIS, ARTHUR, CONSTANCE and attendants

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Before Angiers well met, brave Austria.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Arthur, that great forerunner of thy blood,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Richard, that robb'd the lion of his heart

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And fought the holy wars in Palestine,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: By this brave duke came early to his grave:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And for amends to his posterity,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: At our importance hither is he come,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: To spread his colours, boy, in thy behalf,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And to rebuke the usurpation

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Of thy unnatural uncle, English John:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Embrace him, love him, give him welcome hither.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: God shall forgive you Coeur-de-lion's death

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: The rather that you give his offspring life,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Shadowing their right under your wings of war:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I give you welcome with a powerless hand,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: But with a heart full of unstained love:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Welcome before the gates of Angiers, duke.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: A noble boy! Who would not do thee right?

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Upon thy cheek lay I this zealous kiss,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: As seal to this indenture of my love,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: That to my home I will no more return,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Till Angiers and the right thou hast in France,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Together with that pale, that white-faced shore,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Whose foot spurns back the ocean's roaring tides

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: And coops from other lands her islanders,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Even till that England, hedged in with the main,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: That water-walled bulwark, still secure

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: And confident from foreign purposes,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Even till that utmost corner of the west

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Salute thee for her king: till then, fair boy,

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Will I not think of home, but follow arms.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O, take his mother's thanks, a widow's thanks,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Till your strong hand shall help to give him strength

text_entry: That daily break-vow, he that wins of all,

text_entry: But the word 'maid,' cheats the poor maid of that,

text_entry: Commodity, the bias of the world,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The world, who of itself is peised well,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Made to run even upon even ground,

text_entry: Till this advantage, this vile-drawing bias,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: This sway of motion, this Commodity,

text_entry: Makes it take head from all indifferency,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: From all direction, purpose, course, intent:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And this same bias, this Commodity,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: This bawd, this broker, this all-changing word,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Clapp'd on the outward eye of fickle France,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Hath drawn him from his own determined aid,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: From a resolved and honourable war,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To a most base and vile-concluded peace.

text_entry: Like a poor beggar, raileth on the rich.

text_entry: To say there is no vice but beggary.

text_entry: Shall Lewis have Blanch, and Blanch those provinces?

text_entry: It is not so; thou hast misspoke, misheard:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Be well advised, tell o'er thy tale again:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: It cannot be; thou dost but say 'tis so:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I trust I may not trust thee; for thy word

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Is but the vain breath of a common man:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Believe me, I do not believe thee, man;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I have a king's oath to the contrary.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thou shalt be punish'd for thus frighting me,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: For I am sick and capable of fears,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Oppress'd with wrongs and therefore full of fears,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: A widow, husbandless, subject to fears,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: A woman, naturally born to fears;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And though thou now confess thou didst but jest,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: With my vex'd spirits I cannot take a truce,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: But they will quake and tremble all this day.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: What dost thou mean by shaking of thy head?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Why dost thou look so sadly on my son?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: What means that hand upon that breast of thine?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Why holds thine eye that lamentable rheum,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Like a proud river peering o'er his bounds?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Be these sad signs confirmers of thy words?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Then speak again; not all thy former tale,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: But this one word, whether thy tale be true.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: As true as I believe you think them false

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That give you cause to prove my saying true.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O, if thou teach me to believe this sorrow,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Teach thou this sorrow how to make me die,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And let belief and life encounter so

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: As doth the fury of two desperate men

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Which in the very meeting fall and die.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Lewis marry Blanch! O boy, then where art thou?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: France friend with England, what becomes of me?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Fellow, be gone: I cannot brook thy sight:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: This news hath made thee a most ugly man.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: What other harm have I, good lady, done,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: But spoke the harm that is by others done?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Which harm within itself so heinous is

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: As it makes harmful all that speak of it.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I do beseech you, madam, be content.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: If thou, that bid'st me be content, wert grim,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Ugly and slanderous to thy mother's womb,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Full of unpleasing blots and sightless stains,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Lame, foolish, crooked, swart, prodigious,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Patch'd with foul moles and eye-offending marks,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I would not care, I then would be content,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: For then I should not love thee, no, nor thou

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Become thy great birth nor deserve a crown.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: But thou art fair, and at thy birth, dear boy,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Nature and Fortune join'd to make thee great:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Of Nature's gifts thou mayst with lilies boast,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And with the half-blown rose. But Fortune, O,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: She is corrupted, changed and won from thee;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: She adulterates hourly with thine uncle John,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And with her golden hand hath pluck'd on France

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: To tread down fair respect of sovereignty,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And made his majesty the bawd to theirs.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: France is a bawd to Fortune and King John,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That strumpet Fortune, that usurping John!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Tell me, thou fellow, is not France forsworn?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Envenom him with words, or get thee gone

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And leave those woes alone which I alone

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Am bound to under-bear.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Pardon me, madam,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: I may not go without you to the kings.

text_entry: Thou mayst, thou shalt; I will not go with thee:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I will instruct my sorrows to be proud;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: For grief is proud and makes his owner stoop.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: To me and to the state of my great grief

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Let kings assemble; for my grief's so great

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That no supporter but the huge firm earth

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Can hold it up: here I and sorrows sit;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Here is my throne, bid kings come bow to it.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Seats herself on the ground

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Enter KING JOHN, KING PHILLIP, LEWIS, BLANCH, QUEEN ELINOR, the BASTARD, AUSTRIA, and Attendants

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: 'Tis true, fair daughter; and this blessed day

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Ever in France shall be kept festival:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To solemnize this day the glorious sun

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Stays in his course and plays the alchemist,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Turning with splendor of his precious eye

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: The meagre cloddy earth to glittering gold:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: The yearly course that brings this day about

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Shall never see it but a holiday.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: A wicked day, and not a holy day!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Rising

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: What hath this day deserved? what hath it done,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That it in golden letters should be set

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Among the high tides in the calendar?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Nay, rather turn this day out of the week,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: This day of shame, oppression, perjury.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Or, if it must stand still, let wives with child

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Pray that their burthens may not fall this day,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Lest that their hopes prodigiously be cross'd:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: But on this day let seamen fear no wreck;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: No bargains break that are not this day made:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: This day, all things begun come to ill end,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Yea, faith itself to hollow falsehood change!

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: By heaven, lady, you shall have no cause

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To curse the fair proceedings of this day:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Have I not pawn'd to you my majesty?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: You have beguiled me with a counterfeit

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Resembling majesty, which, being touch'd and tried,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Proves valueless: you are forsworn, forsworn;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: You came in arms to spill mine enemies' blood,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: But now in arms you strengthen it with yours:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: The grappling vigour and rough frown of war

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Is cold in amity and painted peace,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And our oppression hath made up this league.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Arm, arm, you heavens, against these perjured kings!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: A widow cries; be husband to me, heavens!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Let not the hours of this ungodly day

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Wear out the day in peace; but, ere sunset,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Set armed discord 'twixt these perjured kings!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Hear me, O, hear me!

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Lady Constance, peace!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: War! war! no peace! peace is to me a war

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O Lymoges! O Austria! thou dost shame

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That bloody spoil: thou slave, thou wretch, thou coward!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thou little valiant, great in villany!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thou ever strong upon the stronger side!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thou Fortune's champion that dost never fight

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: But when her humorous ladyship is by

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: To teach thee safety! thou art perjured too,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And soothest up greatness. What a fool art thou,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: A ramping fool, to brag and stamp and swear

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Upon my party! Thou cold-blooded slave,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Hast thou not spoke like thunder on my side,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Been sworn my soldier, bidding me depend

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Upon thy stars, thy fortune and thy strength,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And dost thou now fall over to my fores?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thou wear a lion's hide! doff it for shame,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And hang a calf's-skin on those recreant limbs.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: O, that a man should speak those words to me!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And hang a calf's-skin on those recreant limbs.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Thou darest not say so, villain, for thy life.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And hang a calf's-skin on those recreant limbs.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: We like not this; thou dost forget thyself.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enter CARDINAL PANDULPH

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Here comes the holy legate of the pope.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Hail, you anointed deputies of heaven!

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: To thee, King John, my holy errand is.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: I Pandulph, of fair Milan cardinal,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And from Pope Innocent the legate here,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Do in his name religiously demand

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Why thou against the church, our holy mother,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: So wilfully dost spurn; and force perforce

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Keep Stephen Langton, chosen archbishop

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Of Canterbury, from that holy see?

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: This, in our foresaid holy father's name,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Pope Innocent, I do demand of thee.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: What earthy name to interrogatories

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Can task the free breath of a sacred king?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Thou canst not, cardinal, devise a name

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: So slight, unworthy and ridiculous,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To charge me to an answer, as the pope.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Tell him this tale; and from the mouth of England

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Add thus much more, that no Italian priest

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Shall tithe or toll in our dominions;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: But as we, under heaven, are supreme head,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: So under Him that great supremacy,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Where we do reign, we will alone uphold,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Without the assistance of a mortal hand:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: So tell the pope, all reverence set apart

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To him and his usurp'd authority.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Brother of England, you blaspheme in this.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Though you and all the kings of Christendom

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Are led so grossly by this meddling priest,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Dreading the curse that money may buy out;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And by the merit of vile gold, dross, dust,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Purchase corrupted pardon of a man,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Who in that sale sells pardon from himself,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Though you and all the rest so grossly led

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: This juggling witchcraft with revenue cherish,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Yet I alone, alone do me oppose

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Against the pope and count his friends my foes.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Then, by the lawful power that I have,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Thou shalt stand cursed and excommunicate.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And blessed shall he be that doth revolt

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: From his allegiance to an heretic;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And meritorious shall that hand be call'd,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Canonized and worshipped as a saint,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: That takes away by any secret course

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Thy hateful life.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O, lawful let it be

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That I have room with Rome to curse awhile!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Good father cardinal, cry thou amen

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: To my keen curses; for without my wrong

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: There is no tongue hath power to curse him right.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: There's law and warrant, lady, for my curse.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And for mine too: when law can do no right,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Let it be lawful that law bar no wrong:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Law cannot give my child his kingdom here,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: For he that holds his kingdom holds the law;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Therefore, since law itself is perfect wrong,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: How can the law forbid my tongue to curse?

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Philip of France, on peril of a curse,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Let go the hand of that arch-heretic;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And raise the power of France upon his head,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Unless he do submit himself to Rome.

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Look'st thou pale, France? do not let go thy hand.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Look to that, devil; lest that France repent,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And by disjoining hands, hell lose a soul.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: King Philip, listen to the cardinal.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And hang a calf's-skin on his recreant limbs.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Well, ruffian, I must pocket up these wrongs, Because--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your breeches best may carry them.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Philip, what say'st thou to the cardinal?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: What should he say, but as the cardinal?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Bethink you, father; for the difference

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Is purchase of a heavy curse from Rome,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Or the light loss of England for a friend:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Forego the easier.

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: That's the curse of Rome.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O Lewis, stand fast! the devil tempts thee here

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: In likeness of a new untrimmed bride.

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: The Lady Constance speaks not from her faith,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: But from her need.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O, if thou grant my need,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Which only lives but by the death of faith,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That need must needs infer this principle,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That faith would live again by death of need.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O then, tread down my need, and faith mounts up;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Keep my need up, and faith is trodden down!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The king is moved, and answers not to this.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O, be removed from him, and answer well!

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Do so, King Philip; hang no more in doubt.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Hang nothing but a calf's-skin, most sweet lout.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: I am perplex'd, and know not what to say.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: What canst thou say but will perplex thee more,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: If thou stand excommunicate and cursed?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Good reverend father, make my person yours,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And tell me how you would bestow yourself.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: This royal hand and mine are newly knit,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And the conjunction of our inward souls

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Married in league, coupled and linked together

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: With all religious strength of sacred vows;

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: The latest breath that gave the sound of words

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Was deep-sworn faith, peace, amity, true love

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Between our kingdoms and our royal selves,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And even before this truce, but new before,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: No longer than we well could wash our hands

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To clap this royal bargain up of peace,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Heaven knows, they were besmear'd and over-stain'd

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: With slaughter's pencil, where revenge did paint

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: The fearful difference of incensed kings:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And shall these hands, so lately purged of blood,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: So newly join'd in love, so strong in both,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Unyoke this seizure and this kind regreet?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Play fast and loose with faith? so jest with heaven,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Make such unconstant children of ourselves,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: As now again to snatch our palm from palm,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Unswear faith sworn, and on the marriage-bed

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Of smiling peace to march a bloody host,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And make a riot on the gentle brow

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Of true sincerity? O, holy sir,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: My reverend father, let it not be so!

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Out of your grace, devise, ordain, impose

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Some gentle order; and then we shall be blest

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To do your pleasure and continue friends.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: All form is formless, order orderless,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Save what is opposite to England's love.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Therefore to arms! be champion of our church,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Or let the church, our mother, breathe her curse,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: A mother's curse, on her revolting son.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: France, thou mayst hold a serpent by the tongue,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: A chafed lion by the mortal paw,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: A fasting tiger safer by the tooth,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Than keep in peace that hand which thou dost hold.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: I may disjoin my hand, but not my faith.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: So makest thou faith an enemy to faith;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And like a civil war set'st oath to oath,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Thy tongue against thy tongue. O, let thy vow

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: First made to heaven, first be to heaven perform'd,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: That is, to be the champion of our church!

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: What since thou sworest is sworn against thyself

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And may not be performed by thyself,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: For that which thou hast sworn to do amiss

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Is not amiss when it is truly done,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And being not done, where doing tends to ill,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: The truth is then most done not doing it:

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: The better act of purposes mistook

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Is to mistake again; though indirect,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Yet indirection thereby grows direct,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And falsehood falsehood cures, as fire cools fire

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Within the scorched veins of one new-burn'd.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: It is religion that doth make vows kept;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: But thou hast sworn against religion,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: By what thou swear'st against the thing thou swear'st,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And makest an oath the surety for thy truth

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Against an oath: the truth thou art unsure

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: To swear, swears only not to be forsworn;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Else what a mockery should it be to swear!

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: But thou dost swear only to be forsworn;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And most forsworn, to keep what thou dost swear.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Therefore thy later vows against thy first

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Is in thyself rebellion to thyself;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And better conquest never canst thou make

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Than arm thy constant and thy nobler parts

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Against these giddy loose suggestions:

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Upon which better part our prayers come in,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: If thou vouchsafe them. But if not, then know

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: The peril of our curses light on thee

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: So heavy as thou shalt not shake them off,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: But in despair die under their black weight.

speaker: AUSTRIA
text_entry: Rebellion, flat rebellion!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Will't not be?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Will not a calfs-skin stop that mouth of thine?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Father, to arms!

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Upon thy wedding-day?

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Against the blood that thou hast married?

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: What, shall our feast be kept with slaughter'd men?

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Shall braying trumpets and loud churlish drums,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Clamours of hell, be measures to our pomp?

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: O husband, hear me! ay, alack, how new

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Is husband in my mouth! even for that name,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Which till this time my tongue did ne'er pronounce,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Upon my knee I beg, go not to arms

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Against mine uncle.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O, upon my knee,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Made hard with kneeling, I do pray to thee,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thou virtuous Dauphin, alter not the doom

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Forethought by heaven!

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Now shall I see thy love: what motive may

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Be stronger with thee than the name of wife?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That which upholdeth him that thee upholds,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: His honour: O, thine honour, Lewis, thine honour!

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: I muse your majesty doth seem so cold,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: When such profound respects do pull you on.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: I will denounce a curse upon his head.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Thou shalt not need. England, I will fall from thee.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O fair return of banish'd majesty!

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: O foul revolt of French inconstancy!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: France, thou shalt rue this hour within this hour.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Old Time the clock-setter, that bald sexton Time,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Is it as he will? well then, France shall rue.

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: The sun's o'ercast with blood: fair day, adieu!

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Which is the side that I must go withal?

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: I am with both: each army hath a hand;

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: And in their rage, I having hold of both,

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: They swirl asunder and dismember me.

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Husband, I cannot pray that thou mayst win;

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Uncle, I needs must pray that thou mayst lose;

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Father, I may not wish the fortune thine;

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Grandam, I will not wish thy fortunes thrive:

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Whoever wins, on that side shall I lose

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: Assured loss before the match be play'd.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Lady, with me, with me thy fortune lies.

speaker: BLANCH
text_entry: There where my fortune lives, there my life dies.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Cousin, go draw our puissance together.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Exit BASTARD

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: France, I am burn'd up with inflaming wrath;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: A rage whose heat hath this condition,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: That nothing can allay, nothing but blood,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The blood, and dearest-valued blood, of France.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Thy rage sham burn thee up, and thou shalt turn

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: To ashes, ere our blood shall quench that fire:

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Look to thyself, thou art in jeopardy.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: No more than he that threats. To arms let's hie!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: SCENE II. The same. Plains near Angiers.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Alarums, excursions. Enter the BASTARD, with AUSTRIA'S head

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Now, by my life, this day grows wondrous hot;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Some airy devil hovers in the sky

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And pours down mischief. Austria's head lie there,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: While Philip breathes.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Enter KING JOHN, ARTHUR, and HUBERT

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Hubert, keep this boy. Philip, make up:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: My mother is assailed in our tent,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And ta'en, I fear.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: My lord, I rescued her;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Her highness is in safety, fear you not:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But on, my liege; for very little pains

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Will bring this labour to an happy end.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: SCENE III. The same.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Alarums, excursions, retreat. Enter KING JOHN,  QUEEN ELINOR, ARTHUR, the BASTARD, HUBERT, and Lords

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: [To QUEEN ELINOR]  So shall it be; your grace shall

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: stay behind

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: So strongly guarded.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To ARTHUR

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Cousin, look not sad:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Thy grandam loves thee; and thy uncle will

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: As dear be to thee as thy father was.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: O, this will make my mother die with grief!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: [To the BASTARD]  Cousin, away for England!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: haste before:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And, ere our coming, see thou shake the bags

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Of hoarding abbots; imprisoned angels

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Set at liberty: the fat ribs of peace

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Must by the hungry now be fed upon:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Use our commission in his utmost force.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Bell, book, and candle shall not drive me back,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: When gold and silver becks me to come on.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I leave your highness. Grandam, I will pray,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: If ever I remember to be holy,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For your fair safety; so, I kiss your hand.

speaker: ELINOR
text_entry: Farewell, gentle cousin.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Coz, farewell.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Exit the BASTARD

speaker: QUEEN ELINOR
text_entry: Come hither, little kinsman; hark, a word.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Come hither, Hubert. O my gentle Hubert,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: We owe thee much! within this wall of flesh

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: There is a soul counts thee her creditor

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And with advantage means to pay thy love:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And my good friend, thy voluntary oath

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Lives in this bosom, dearly cherished.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Give me thy hand. I had a thing to say,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: But I will fit it with some better time.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: By heaven, Hubert, I am almost ashamed

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To say what good respect I have of thee.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I am much bounden to your majesty.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Good friend, thou hast no cause to say so yet,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: But thou shalt have; and creep time ne'er so slow,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Yet it shall come from me to do thee good.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: I had a thing to say, but let it go:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The sun is in the heaven, and the proud day,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Attended with the pleasures of the world,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Is all too wanton and too full of gawds

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To give me audience: if the midnight bell

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Did, with his iron tongue and brazen mouth,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Sound on into the drowsy race of night;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: If this same were a churchyard where we stand,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And thou possessed with a thousand wrongs,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Or if that surly spirit, melancholy,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Had baked thy blood and made it heavy-thick,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Which else runs tickling up and down the veins,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Making that idiot, laughter, keep men's eyes

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And strain their cheeks to idle merriment,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: A passion hateful to my purposes,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Or if that thou couldst see me without eyes,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Hear me without thine ears, and make reply

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Without a tongue, using conceit alone,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Without eyes, ears and harmful sound of words;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Then, in despite of brooded watchful day,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: I would into thy bosom pour my thoughts:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: But, ah, I will not! yet I love thee well;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And, by my troth, I think thou lovest me well.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: So well, that what you bid me undertake,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Though that my death were adjunct to my act,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: By heaven, I would do it.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Do not I know thou wouldst?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Good Hubert, Hubert, Hubert, throw thine eye

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: On yon young boy: I'll tell thee what, my friend,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: He is a very serpent in my way;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And whereso'er this foot of mine doth tread,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: He lies before me: dost thou understand me?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Thou art his keeper.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: And I'll keep him so,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: That he shall not offend your majesty.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Death.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: A grave.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: He shall not live.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enough.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: I could be merry now. Hubert, I love thee;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Well, I'll not say what I intend for thee:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Remember. Madam, fare you well:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: I'll send those powers o'er to your majesty.

speaker: ELINOR
text_entry: My blessing go with thee!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: For England, cousin, go:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Hubert shall be your man, attend on you

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: With all true duty. On toward Calais, ho!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: SCENE IV. The same. KING PHILIP'S tent.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enter KING PHILIP, LEWIS, CARDINAL PANDULPH, and Attendants

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: So, by a roaring tempest on the flood,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: A whole armado of convicted sail

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Is scatter'd and disjoin'd from fellowship.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Courage and comfort! all shall yet go well.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: What can go well, when we have run so ill?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Are we not beaten? Is not Angiers lost?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Arthur ta'en prisoner? divers dear friends slain?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: And bloody England into England gone,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: O'erbearing interruption, spite of France?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: What he hath won, that hath he fortified:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: So hot a speed with such advice disposed,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Such temperate order in so fierce a cause,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Doth want example: who hath read or heard

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Of any kindred action like to this?

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Well could I bear that England had this praise,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: So we could find some pattern of our shame.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Enter CONSTANCE

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Look, who comes here! a grave unto a soul;

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Holding the eternal spirit against her will,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: In the vile prison of afflicted breath.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: I prithee, lady, go away with me.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Lo, now I now see the issue of your peace.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Patience, good lady! comfort, gentle Constance!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: No, I defy all counsel, all redress,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: But that which ends all counsel, true redress,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Death, death; O amiable lovely death!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thou odouriferous stench! sound rottenness!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Arise forth from the couch of lasting night,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thou hate and terror to prosperity,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And I will kiss thy detestable bones

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And put my eyeballs in thy vaulty brows

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And ring these fingers with thy household worms

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And stop this gap of breath with fulsome dust

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And be a carrion monster like thyself:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Come, grin on me, and I will think thou smilest

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And buss thee as thy wife. Misery's love,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O, come to me!

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: O fair affliction, peace!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: No, no, I will not, having breath to cry:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O, that my tongue were in the thunder's mouth!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Then with a passion would I shake the world;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And rouse from sleep that fell anatomy

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Which cannot hear a lady's feeble voice,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Which scorns a modern invocation.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Lady, you utter madness, and not sorrow.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Thou art not holy to belie me so;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I am not mad: this hair I tear is mine;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: My name is Constance; I was Geffrey's wife;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Young Arthur is my son, and he is lost:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I am not mad: I would to heaven I were!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: For then, 'tis like I should forget myself:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O, if I could, what grief should I forget!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Preach some philosophy to make me mad,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And thou shalt be canonized, cardinal;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: For being not mad but sensible of grief,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: My reasonable part produces reason

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: How I may be deliver'd of these woes,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And teaches me to kill or hang myself:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: If I were mad, I should forget my son,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Or madly think a babe of clouts were he:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I am not mad; too well, too well I feel

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: The different plague of each calamity.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Bind up those tresses. O, what love I note

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: In the fair multitude of those her hairs!

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Where but by chance a silver drop hath fallen,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Even to that drop ten thousand wiry friends

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Do glue themselves in sociable grief,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Like true, inseparable, faithful loves,

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Sticking together in calamity.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: To England, if you will.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Bind up your hairs.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Yes, that I will; and wherefore will I do it?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I tore them from their bonds and cried aloud

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: 'O that these hands could so redeem my son,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: As they have given these hairs their liberty!'

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: But now I envy at their liberty,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And will again commit them to their bonds,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Because my poor child is a prisoner.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And, father cardinal, I have heard you say

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: That we shall see and know our friends in heaven:

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: If that be true, I shall see my boy again;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: For since the birth of Cain, the first male child,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: To him that did but yesterday suspire,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: There was not such a gracious creature born.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: But now will canker-sorrow eat my bud

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And chase the native beauty from his cheek

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And he will look as hollow as a ghost,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: As dim and meagre as an ague's fit,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: And so he'll die; and, rising so again,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: When I shall meet him in the court of heaven

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I shall not know him: therefore never, never

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Must I behold my pretty Arthur more.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: You hold too heinous a respect of grief.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: He talks to me that never had a son.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: You are as fond of grief as of your child.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Grief fills the room up of my absent child,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Lies in his bed, walks up and down with me,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Puts on his pretty looks, repeats his words,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Remembers me of all his gracious parts,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Stuffs out his vacant garments with his form;

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Then, have I reason to be fond of grief?

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Fare you well: had you such a loss as I,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I could give better comfort than you do.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: I will not keep this form upon my head,

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: When there is such disorder in my wit.

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: O Lord! my boy, my Arthur, my fair son!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: My life, my joy, my food, my all the world!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: My widow-comfort, and my sorrows' cure!

speaker: CONSTANCE
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: I fear some outrage, and I'll follow her.

speaker: KING PHILIP
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: There's nothing in this world can make me joy:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Life is as tedious as a twice-told tale

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Vexing the dull ear of a drowsy man;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And bitter shame hath spoil'd the sweet world's taste

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: That it yields nought but shame and bitterness.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Before the curing of a strong disease,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Even in the instant of repair and health,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: The fit is strongest; evils that take leave,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: On their departure most of all show evil:

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: What have you lost by losing of this day?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: All days of glory, joy and happiness.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: If you had won it, certainly you had.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: No, no; when Fortune means to men most good,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: She looks upon them with a threatening eye.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: 'Tis strange to think how much King John hath lost

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: In this which he accounts so clearly won:

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Are not you grieved that Arthur is his prisoner?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: As heartily as he is glad he hath him.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Your mind is all as youthful as your blood.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Now hear me speak with a prophetic spirit;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: For even the breath of what I mean to speak

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Shall blow each dust, each straw, each little rub,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Out of the path which shall directly lead

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Thy foot to England's throne; and therefore mark.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: John hath seized Arthur; and it cannot be

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: That, whiles warm life plays in that infant's veins,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: The misplaced John should entertain an hour,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: One minute, nay, one quiet breath of rest.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: A sceptre snatch'd with an unruly hand

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Must be as boisterously maintain'd as gain'd;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And he that stands upon a slippery place

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Makes nice of no vile hold to stay him up:

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: That John may stand, then Arthur needs must fall;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: So be it, for it cannot be but so.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: But what shall I gain by young Arthur's fall?

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: You, in the right of Lady Blanch your wife,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: May then make all the claim that Arthur did.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And lose it, life and all, as Arthur did.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: How green you are and fresh in this old world!

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: John lays you plots; the times conspire with you;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: For he that steeps his safety in true blood

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Shall find but bloody safety and untrue.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: This act so evilly born shall cool the hearts

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Of all his people and freeze up their zeal,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: That none so small advantage shall step forth

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: To cheque his reign, but they will cherish it;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: No natural exhalation in the sky,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: No scope of nature, no distemper'd day,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: No common wind, no customed event,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: But they will pluck away his natural cause

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And call them meteors, prodigies and signs,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Abortives, presages and tongues of heaven,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Plainly denouncing vengeance upon John.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: May be he will not touch young Arthur's life,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: But hold himself safe in his prisonment.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: O, sir, when he shall hear of your approach,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: If that young Arthur be not gone already,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Even at that news he dies; and then the hearts

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Of all his people shall revolt from him

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And kiss the lips of unacquainted change

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And pick strong matter of revolt and wrath

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Out of the bloody fingers' ends of John.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Methinks I see this hurly all on foot:

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And, O, what better matter breeds for you

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Than I have named! The bastard Faulconbridge

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Is now in England, ransacking the church,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Offending charity: if but a dozen French

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Were there in arms, they would be as a call

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: To train ten thousand English to their side,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Or as a little snow, tumbled about,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Anon becomes a mountain. O noble Dauphin,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Go with me to the king: 'tis wonderful

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: What may be wrought out of their discontent,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Now that their souls are topful of offence.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: For England go: I will whet on the king.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Strong reasons make strong actions: let us go:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: If you say ay, the king will not say no.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: SCENE I. A room in a castle.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Enter HUBERT and Executioners

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Heat me these irons hot; and look thou stand

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Within the arras: when I strike my foot

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Upon the bosom of the ground, rush forth,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: And bind the boy which you shall find with me

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Fast to the chair: be heedful: hence, and watch.

speaker: First Executioner
text_entry: I hope your warrant will bear out the deed.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Uncleanly scruples! fear not you: look to't.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Exeunt Executioners

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Young lad, come forth; I have to say with you.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Enter ARTHUR

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Good morrow, Hubert.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Good morrow, little prince.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: As little prince, having so great a title

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: To be more prince, as may be. You are sad.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Indeed, I have been merrier.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Mercy on me!

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Methinks no body should be sad but I:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Yet, I remember, when I was in France,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Young gentlemen would be as sad as night,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Only for wantonness. By my christendom,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: So I were out of prison and kept sheep,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I should be as merry as the day is long;

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And so I would be here, but that I doubt

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: My uncle practises more harm to me:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: He is afraid of me and I of him:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Is it my fault that I was Geffrey's son?

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: No, indeed, is't not; and I would to heaven

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I were your son, so you would love me, Hubert.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: [Aside]  If I talk to him, with his innocent prate

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: He will awake my mercy which lies dead:

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Therefore I will be sudden and dispatch.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Are you sick, Hubert? you look pale to-day:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: In sooth, I would you were a little sick,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: That I might sit all night and watch with you:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I warrant I love you more than you do me.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: [Aside]  His words do take possession of my bosom.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Read here, young Arthur.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Showing a paper

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Aside

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: How now, foolish rheum!

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Turning dispiteous torture out of door!

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I must be brief, lest resolution drop

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Out at mine eyes in tender womanish tears.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Can you not read it? Is it not fair writ?

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Too fairly, Hubert, for so foul effect:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Must you with hot irons burn out both mine eyes?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Young boy, I must.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: And will you?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: And I will.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Have you the heart? When your head did but ache,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I knit my handercher about your brows,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: The best I had, a princess wrought it me,

speaker: KING JOHN
