speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Witness against us to damnation!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: How oft the sight of means to do ill deeds

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Make deeds ill done! Hadst not thou been by,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: A fellow by the hand of nature mark'd,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Quoted and sign'd to do a deed of shame,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: This murder had not come into my mind:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: But taking note of thy abhorr'd aspect,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Finding thee fit for bloody villany,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Apt, liable to be employ'd in danger,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: I faintly broke with thee of Arthur's death;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And thou, to be endeared to a king,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Made it no conscience to destroy a prince.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: My lord--

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Hadst thou but shook thy head or made a pause

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: When I spake darkly what I purposed,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Or turn'd an eye of doubt upon my face,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: As bid me tell my tale in express words,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Deep shame had struck me dumb, made me break off,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And those thy fears might have wrought fears in me:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: But thou didst understand me by my signs

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And didst in signs again parley with sin;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Yea, without stop, didst let thy heart consent,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And consequently thy rude hand to act

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The deed, which both our tongues held vile to name.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Out of my sight, and never see me more!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: My nobles leave me; and my state is braved,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Even at my gates, with ranks of foreign powers:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Nay, in the body of this fleshly land,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: This kingdom, this confine of blood and breath,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Hostility and civil tumult reigns

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Between my conscience and my cousin's death.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Arm you against your other enemies,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I'll make a peace between your soul and you.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Young Arthur is alive: this hand of mine

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Is yet a maiden and an innocent hand,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Not painted with the crimson spots of blood.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Within this bosom never enter'd yet

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: The dreadful motion of a murderous thought;

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: And you have slander'd nature in my form,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Which, howsoever rude exteriorly,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Is yet the cover of a fairer mind

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Than to be butcher of an innocent child.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Doth Arthur live? O, haste thee to the peers,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Throw this report on their incensed rage,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And make them tame to their obedience!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Forgive the comment that my passion made

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Upon thy feature; for my rage was blind,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And foul imaginary eyes of blood

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Presented thee more hideous than thou art.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: O, answer not, but to my closet bring

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The angry lords with all expedient haste.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: I conjure thee but slowly; run more fast.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: SCENE III. Before the castle.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enter ARTHUR, on the walls

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: The wall is high, and yet will I leap down:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Good ground, be pitiful and hurt me not!

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: There's few or none do know me: if they did,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: This ship-boy's semblance hath disguised me quite.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I am afraid; and yet I'll venture it.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: If I get down, and do not break my limbs,

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: I'll find a thousand shifts to get away:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: As good to die and go, as die and stay.

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Leaps down

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: O me! my uncle's spirit is in these stones:

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Heaven take my soul, and England keep my bones!

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Dies

speaker: ARTHUR
text_entry: Enter PEMBROKE, SALISBURY, and BIGOT

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Lords, I will meet him at Saint Edmundsbury:

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: It is our safety, and we must embrace

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: This gentle offer of the perilous time.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Who brought that letter from the cardinal?

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The Count Melun, a noble lord of France,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Whose private with me of the Dauphin's love

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Is much more general than these lines import.

speaker: BIGOT
text_entry: To-morrow morning let us meet him then.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Or rather then set forward; for 'twill be

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Two long days' journey, lords, or ere we meet.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Enter the BASTARD

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Once more to-day well met, distemper'd lords!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The king by me requests your presence straight.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The king hath dispossess'd himself of us:

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: We will not line his thin bestained cloak

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: With our pure honours, nor attend the foot

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That leaves the print of blood where'er it walks.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Return and tell him so: we know the worst.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Whate'er you think, good words, I think, were best.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Our griefs, and not our manners, reason now.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But there is little reason in your grief;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Therefore 'twere reason you had manners now.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Sir, sir, impatience hath his privilege.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: 'Tis true, to hurt his master, no man else.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: This is the prison. What is he lies here?

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Seeing ARTHUR

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: O death, made proud with pure and princely beauty!

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: The earth had not a hole to hide this deed.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Murder, as hating what himself hath done,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Doth lay it open to urge on revenge.

speaker: BIGOT
text_entry: Or, when he doom'd this beauty to a grave,

speaker: BIGOT
text_entry: Found it too precious-princely for a grave.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Sir Richard, what think you? have you beheld,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Or have you read or heard? or could you think?

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Or do you almost think, although you see,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That you do see? could thought, without this object,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Form such another? This is the very top,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The height, the crest, or crest unto the crest,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Of murder's arms: this is the bloodiest shame,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The wildest savagery, the vilest stroke,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That ever wall-eyed wrath or staring rage

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Presented to the tears of soft remorse.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: All murders past do stand excused in this:

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: And this, so sole and so unmatchable,

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Shall give a holiness, a purity,

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: To the yet unbegotten sin of times;

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: And prove a deadly bloodshed but a jest,

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Exampled by this heinous spectacle.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: It is a damned and a bloody work;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The graceless action of a heavy hand,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: If that it be the work of any hand.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: If that it be the work of any hand!

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: We had a kind of light what would ensue:

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: It is the shameful work of Hubert's hand;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The practise and the purpose of the king:

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: From whose obedience I forbid my soul,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Kneeling before this ruin of sweet life,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And breathing to his breathless excellence

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The incense of a vow, a holy vow,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Never to taste the pleasures of the world,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Never to be infected with delight,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Nor conversant with ease and idleness,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Till I have set a glory to this hand,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: By giving it the worship of revenge.

speaker: BIGOT
text_entry: Our souls religiously confirm thy words.

speaker: BIGOT
text_entry: Enter HUBERT

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Lords, I am hot with haste in seeking you:

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Arthur doth live; the king hath sent for you.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: O, he is old and blushes not at death.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Avaunt, thou hateful villain, get thee gone!

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I am no villain.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Must I rob the law?

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Drawing his sword

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your sword is bright, sir; put it up again.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Not till I sheathe it in a murderer's skin.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Stand back, Lord Salisbury, stand back, I say;

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: By heaven, I think my sword's as sharp as yours:

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I would not have you, lord, forget yourself,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Nor tempt the danger of my true defence;

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Lest I, by marking of your rage, forget

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Your worth, your greatness and nobility.

speaker: BIGOT
text_entry: Out, dunghill! darest thou brave a nobleman?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Not for my life: but yet I dare defend

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: My innocent life against an emperor.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Thou art a murderer.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Do not prove me so;

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Yet I am none: whose tongue soe'er speaks false,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Not truly speaks; who speaks not truly, lies.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Cut him to pieces.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Keep the peace, I say.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Stand by, or I shall gall you, Faulconbridge.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Thou wert better gall the devil, Salisbury:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: If thou but frown on me, or stir thy foot,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Or teach thy hasty spleen to do me shame,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I'll strike thee dead. Put up thy sword betime;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Or I'll so maul you and your toasting-iron,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That you shall think the devil is come from hell.

speaker: BIGOT
text_entry: What wilt thou do, renowned Faulconbridge?

speaker: BIGOT
text_entry: Second a villain and a murderer?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Lord Bigot, I am none.

speaker: BIGOT
text_entry: Who kill'd this prince?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: 'Tis not an hour since I left him well:

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I honour'd him, I loved him, and will weep

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: My date of life out for his sweet life's loss.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Trust not those cunning waters of his eyes,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: For villany is not without such rheum;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And he, long traded in it, makes it seem

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Like rivers of remorse and innocency.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Away with me, all you whose souls abhor

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The uncleanly savours of a slaughter-house;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: For I am stifled with this smell of sin.

speaker: BIGOT
text_entry: Away toward Bury, to the Dauphin there!

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: There tell the king he may inquire us out.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Exeunt Lords

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Here's a good world! Knew you of this fair work?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Beyond the infinite and boundless reach

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Of mercy, if thou didst this deed of death,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Art thou damn'd, Hubert.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Do but hear me, sir.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Ha! I'll tell thee what;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Thou'rt damn'd as black--nay, nothing is so black;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Thou art more deep damn'd than Prince Lucifer:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: There is not yet so ugly a fiend of hell

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As thou shalt be, if thou didst kill this child.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Upon my soul--

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: If thou didst but consent

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To this most cruel act, do but despair;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And if thou want'st a cord, the smallest thread

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That ever spider twisted from her womb

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Will serve to strangle thee, a rush will be a beam

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To hang thee on; or wouldst thou drown thyself,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Put but a little water in a spoon,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And it shall be as all the ocean,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Enough to stifle such a villain up.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I do suspect thee very grievously.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: If I in act, consent, or sin of thought,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Be guilty of the stealing that sweet breath

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Which was embounded in this beauteous clay,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Let hell want pains enough to torture me.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I left him well.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Go, bear him in thine arms.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I am amazed, methinks, and lose my way

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Among the thorns and dangers of this world.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: How easy dost thou take all England up!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: From forth this morsel of dead royalty,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The life, the right and truth of all this realm

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Is fled to heaven; and England now is left

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To tug and scamble and to part by the teeth

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The unowed interest of proud-swelling state.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Now for the bare-pick'd bone of majesty

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Doth dogged war bristle his angry crest

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And snarleth in the gentle eyes of peace:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Now powers from home and discontents at home

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Meet in one line; and vast confusion waits,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As doth a raven on a sick-fall'n beast,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The imminent decay of wrested pomp.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Now happy he whose cloak and cincture can

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Hold out this tempest. Bear away that child

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And follow me with speed: I'll to the king:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: A thousand businesses are brief in hand,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And heaven itself doth frown upon the land.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: ACT V

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: SCENE I. KING JOHN'S palace.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Enter KING JOHN, CARDINAL PANDULPH, and Attendants

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Thus have I yielded up into your hand

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The circle of my glory.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Giving the crown

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Take again

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: From this my hand, as holding of the pope

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Your sovereign greatness and authority.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Now keep your holy word: go meet the French,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And from his holiness use all your power

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To stop their marches 'fore we are inflamed.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Our discontented counties do revolt;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Our people quarrel with obedience,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Swearing allegiance and the love of soul

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To stranger blood, to foreign royalty.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: This inundation of mistemper'd humour

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Rests by you only to be qualified:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Then pause not; for the present time's so sick,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: That present medicine must be minister'd,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Or overthrow incurable ensues.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: It was my breath that blew this tempest up,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Upon your stubborn usage of the pope;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: But since you are a gentle convertite,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: My tongue shall hush again this storm of war

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And make fair weather in your blustering land.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: On this Ascension-day, remember well,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Upon your oath of service to the pope,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Go I to make the French lay down their arms.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Is this Ascension-day? Did not the prophet

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Say that before Ascension-day at noon

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: My crown I should give off? Even so I have:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: I did suppose it should be on constraint:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: But, heaven be thank'd, it is but voluntary.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enter the BASTARD

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: All Kent hath yielded; nothing there holds out

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But Dover castle: London hath received,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Like a kind host, the Dauphin and his powers:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Your nobles will not hear you, but are gone

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To offer service to your enemy,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And wild amazement hurries up and down

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The little number of your doubtful friends.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Would not my lords return to me again,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: After they heard young Arthur was alive?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: They found him dead and cast into the streets,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: An empty casket, where the jewel of life

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: By some damn'd hand was robb'd and ta'en away.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: That villain Hubert told me he did live.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: So, on my soul, he did, for aught he knew.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But wherefore do you droop? why look you sad?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Be great in act, as you have been in thought;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Let not the world see fear and sad distrust

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Govern the motion of a kingly eye:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Be stirring as the time; be fire with fire;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Threaten the threatener and outface the brow

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Of bragging horror: so shall inferior eyes,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That borrow their behaviors from the great,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Grow great by your example and put on

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The dauntless spirit of resolution.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Away, and glister like the god of war,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: When he intendeth to become the field:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Show boldness and aspiring confidence.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: What, shall they seek the lion in his den,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And fright him there? and make him tremble there?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O, let it not be said: forage, and run

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To meet displeasure farther from the doors,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And grapple with him ere he comes so nigh.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The legate of the pope hath been with me,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And I have made a happy peace with him;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And he hath promised to dismiss the powers

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Led by the Dauphin.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O inglorious league!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Shall we, upon the footing of our land,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Send fair-play orders and make compromise,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Insinuation, parley and base truce

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To arms invasive? shall a beardless boy,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: A cocker'd silken wanton, brave our fields,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And flesh his spirit in a warlike soil,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Mocking the air with colours idly spread,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And find no cheque? Let us, my liege, to arms:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Perchance the cardinal cannot make your peace;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Or if he do, let it at least be said

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: They saw we had a purpose of defence.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Have thou the ordering of this present time.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Away, then, with good courage! yet, I know,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Our party may well meet a prouder foe.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: SCENE II. LEWIS's camp at St. Edmundsbury.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Enter, in arms, LEWIS, SALISBURY, MELUN, PEMBROKE, BIGOT, and Soldiers

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: My Lord Melun, let this be copied out,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And keep it safe for our remembrance:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Return the precedent to these lords again;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: That, having our fair order written down,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Both they and we, perusing o'er these notes,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: May know wherefore we took the sacrament

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And keep our faiths firm and inviolable.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Upon our sides it never shall be broken.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And, noble Dauphin, albeit we swear

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: A voluntary zeal and an unurged faith

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: To your proceedings; yet believe me, prince,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: I am not glad that such a sore of time

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Should seek a plaster by contemn'd revolt,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And heal the inveterate canker of one wound

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: By making many. O, it grieves my soul,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That I must draw this metal from my side

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: To be a widow-maker! O, and there

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Where honourable rescue and defence

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Cries out upon the name of Salisbury!

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: But such is the infection of the time,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That, for the health and physic of our right,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: We cannot deal but with the very hand

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Of stern injustice and confused wrong.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And is't not pity, O my grieved friends,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That we, the sons and children of this isle,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Were born to see so sad an hour as this;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Wherein we step after a stranger march

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Upon her gentle bosom, and fill up

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Her enemies' ranks,--I must withdraw and weep

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Upon the spot of this enforced cause,--

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: To grace the gentry of a land remote,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And follow unacquainted colours here?

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: What, here? O nation, that thou couldst remove!

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That Neptune's arms, who clippeth thee about,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Would bear thee from the knowledge of thyself,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And grapple thee unto a pagan shore;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Where these two Christian armies might combine

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The blood of malice in a vein of league,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And not to spend it so unneighbourly!

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: A noble temper dost thou show in this;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And great affections wrestling in thy bosom

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Doth make an earthquake of nobility.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: O, what a noble combat hast thou fought

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Between compulsion and a brave respect!

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Let me wipe off this honourable dew,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: That silverly doth progress on thy cheeks:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: My heart hath melted at a lady's tears,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Being an ordinary inundation;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: But this effusion of such manly drops,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: This shower, blown up by tempest of the soul,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Startles mine eyes, and makes me more amazed

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Than had I seen the vaulty top of heaven

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Figured quite o'er with burning meteors.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Lift up thy brow, renowned Salisbury,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And with a great heart heave away the storm:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Commend these waters to those baby eyes

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: That never saw the giant world enraged;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Nor met with fortune other than at feasts,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Full of warm blood, of mirth, of gossiping.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Come, come; for thou shalt thrust thy hand as deep

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Into the purse of rich prosperity

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: As Lewis himself: so, nobles, shall you all,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: That knit your sinews to the strength of mine.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And even there, methinks, an angel spake:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Enter CARDINAL PANDULPH

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Look, where the holy legate comes apace,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: To give us warrant from the hand of heaven

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And on our actions set the name of right

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: With holy breath.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Hail, noble prince of France!

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: The next is this, King John hath reconciled

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Himself to Rome; his spirit is come in,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: That so stood out against the holy church,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: The great metropolis and see of Rome:

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Therefore thy threatening colours now wind up;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And tame the savage spirit of wild war,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: That like a lion foster'd up at hand,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: It may lie gently at the foot of peace,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And be no further harmful than in show.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Your grace shall pardon me, I will not back:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: I am too high-born to be propertied,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: To be a secondary at control,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Or useful serving-man and instrument,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: To any sovereign state throughout the world.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Your breath first kindled the dead coal of wars

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Between this chastised kingdom and myself,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And brought in matter that should feed this fire;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And now 'tis far too huge to be blown out

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: With that same weak wind which enkindled it.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: You taught me how to know the face of right,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Acquainted me with interest to this land,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Yea, thrust this enterprise into my heart;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And come ye now to tell me John hath made

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: His peace with Rome? What is that peace to me?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: I, by the honour of my marriage-bed,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: After young Arthur, claim this land for mine;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And, now it is half-conquer'd, must I back

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Because that John hath made his peace with Rome?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Am I Rome's slave? What penny hath Rome borne,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: What men provided, what munition sent,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: To underprop this action? Is't not I

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: That undergo this charge? who else but I,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And such as to my claim are liable,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Sweat in this business and maintain this war?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Have I not heard these islanders shout out

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: 'Vive le roi!' as I have bank'd their towns?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Have I not here the best cards for the game,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: To win this easy match play'd for a crown?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And shall I now give o'er the yielded set?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: No, no, on my soul, it never shall be said.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: You look but on the outside of this work.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Outside or inside, I will not return

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Till my attempt so much be glorified

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: As to my ample hope was promised

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Before I drew this gallant head of war,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And cull'd these fiery spirits from the world,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: To outlook conquest and to win renown

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Even in the jaws of danger and of death.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Trumpet sounds

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: What lusty trumpet thus doth summon us?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Enter the BASTARD, attended

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: According to the fair play of the world,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Let me have audience; I am sent to speak:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: My holy lord of Milan, from the king

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I come, to learn how you have dealt for him;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And, as you answer, I do know the scope

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And warrant limited unto my tongue.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: The Dauphin is too wilful-opposite,

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: And will not temporize with my entreaties;

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: He flatly says he'll not lay down his arms.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: By all the blood that ever fury breathed,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The youth says well. Now hear our English king;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For thus his royalty doth speak in me.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: He is prepared, and reason too he should:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: This apish and unmannerly approach,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: This harness'd masque and unadvised revel,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: This unhair'd sauciness and boyish troops,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The king doth smile at; and is well prepared

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To whip this dwarfish war, these pigmy arms,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: From out the circle of his territories.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That hand which had the strength, even at your door,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To cudgel you and make you take the hatch,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To dive like buckets in concealed wells,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To crouch in litter of your stable planks,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To lie like pawns lock'd up in chests and trunks,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To hug with swine, to seek sweet safety out

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: In vaults and prisons, and to thrill and shake

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Even at the crying of your nation's crow,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Thinking his voice an armed Englishman;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Shall that victorious hand be feebled here,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That in your chambers gave you chastisement?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: No: know the gallant monarch is in arms

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And like an eagle o'er his aery towers,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To souse annoyance that comes near his nest.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And you degenerate, you ingrate revolts,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: You bloody Neroes, ripping up the womb

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Of your dear mother England, blush for shame;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For your own ladies and pale-visaged maids

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Like Amazons come tripping after drums,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Their thimbles into armed gauntlets change,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Their needles to lances, and their gentle hearts

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To fierce and bloody inclination.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: There end thy brave, and turn thy face in peace;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: We grant thou canst outscold us: fare thee well;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: We hold our time too precious to be spent

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: With such a brabbler.

speaker: CARDINAL PANDULPH
text_entry: Give me leave to speak.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: No, I will speak.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: We will attend to neither.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Strike up the drums; and let the tongue of war

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Plead for our interest and our being here.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Indeed your drums, being beaten, will cry out;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And so shall you, being beaten: do but start

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: An echo with the clamour of thy drum,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And even at hand a drum is ready braced

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: That shall reverberate all as loud as thine;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Sound but another, and another shall

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As loud as thine rattle the welkin's ear

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And mock the deep-mouth'd thunder: for at hand,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Not trusting to this halting legate here,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Whom he hath used rather for sport than need

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Is warlike John; and in his forehead sits

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: A bare-ribb'd death, whose office is this day

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To feast upon whole thousands of the French.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Strike up our drums, to find this danger out.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And thou shalt find it, Dauphin, do not doubt.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: SCENE III. The field of battle.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Alarums. Enter KING JOHN and HUBERT

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: How goes the day with us? O, tell me, Hubert.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Badly, I fear. How fares your majesty?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: This fever, that hath troubled me so long,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Lies heavy on me; O, my heart is sick!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: My lord, your valiant kinsman, Faulconbridge,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Desires your majesty to leave the field

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And send him word by me which way you go.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Tell him, toward Swinstead, to the abbey there.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Be of good comfort; for the great supply

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: That was expected by the Dauphin here,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Are wreck'd three nights ago on Goodwin Sands.

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: This news was brought to Richard but even now:

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The French fight coldly, and retire themselves.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Ay me! this tyrant fever burns me up,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And will not let me welcome this good news.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Set on toward Swinstead: to my litter straight;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Weakness possesseth me, and I am faint.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: SCENE IV. Another part of the field.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enter SALISBURY, PEMBROKE, and BIGOT

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: I did not think the king so stored with friends.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Up once again; put spirit in the French:

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: If they miscarry, we miscarry too.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: That misbegotten devil, Faulconbridge,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: In spite of spite, alone upholds the day.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: They say King John sore sick hath left the field.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Enter MELUN, wounded

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Lead me to the revolts of England here.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: When we were happy we had other names.

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: It is the Count Melun.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Wounded to death.

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Fly, noble English, you are bought and sold;

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Unthread the rude eye of rebellion

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: And welcome home again discarded faith.

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Seek out King John and fall before his feet;

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: For if the French be lords of this loud day,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: He means to recompense the pains you take

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: By cutting off your heads: thus hath he sworn

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: And I with him, and many moe with me,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Upon the altar at Saint Edmundsbury;

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Even on that altar where we swore to you

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Dear amity and everlasting love.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: May this be possible? may this be true?

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Have I not hideous death within my view,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Retaining but a quantity of life,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Which bleeds away, even as a form of wax

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Resolveth from his figure 'gainst the fire?

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: What in the world should make me now deceive,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Since I must lose the use of all deceit?

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Why should I then be false, since it is true

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: That I must die here and live hence by truth?

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: I say again, if Lewis do win the day,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: He is forsworn, if e'er those eyes of yours

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Behold another day break in the east:

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: But even this night, whose black contagious breath

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Already smokes about the burning crest

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Of the old, feeble and day-wearied sun,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Even this ill night, your breathing shall expire,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Paying the fine of rated treachery

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Even with a treacherous fine of all your lives,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: If Lewis by your assistance win the day.

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Commend me to one Hubert with your king:

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: The love of him, and this respect besides,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: For that my grandsire was an Englishman,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Awakes my conscience to confess all this.

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: In lieu whereof, I pray you, bear me hence

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: From forth the noise and rumour of the field,

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: Where I may think the remnant of my thoughts

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: In peace, and part this body and my soul

speaker: MELUN
text_entry: With contemplation and devout desires.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: We do believe thee: and beshrew my soul

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: But I do love the favour and the form

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Of this most fair occasion, by the which

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: We will untread the steps of damned flight,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And like a bated and retired flood,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Leaving our rankness and irregular course,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Stoop low within those bounds we have o'erlook'd

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And cabby run on in obedience

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Even to our ocean, to our great King John.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: My arm shall give thee help to bear thee hence;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: For I do see the cruel pangs of death

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Right in thine eye. Away, my friends! New flight;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And happy newness, that intends old right.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Exeunt, leading off MELUN

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: SCENE V. The French camp.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Enter LEWIS and his train

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: The sun of heaven methought was loath to set,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: But stay'd and made the western welkin blush,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: When English measure backward their own ground

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: In faint retire. O, bravely came we off,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: When with a volley of our needless shot,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: After such bloody toil, we bid good night;

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: And wound our tattering colours clearly up,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Last in the field, and almost lords of it!

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Enter a Messenger

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Where is my prince, the Dauphin?

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Here: what news?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: The Count Melun is slain; the English lords

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: By his persuasion are again fall'n off,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: And your supply, which you have wish'd so long,

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Are cast away and sunk on Goodwin Sands.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Ah, foul shrewd news! beshrew thy very heart!

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: I did not think to be so sad to-night

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: As this hath made me. Who was he that said

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: King John did fly an hour or two before

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: The stumbling night did part our weary powers?

speaker: Messenger
text_entry: Whoever spoke it, it is true, my lord.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Well; keep good quarter and good care to-night:

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: The day shall not be up so soon as I,

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: To try the fair adventure of to-morrow.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: SCENE VI. An open place in the neighbourhood of Swinstead Abbey.

speaker: LEWIS
text_entry: Enter the BASTARD and HUBERT, severally

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Who's there? speak, ho! speak quickly, or I shoot.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: A friend. What art thou?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Of the part of England.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Whither dost thou go?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: What's that to thee? why may not I demand

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Of thine affairs, as well as thou of mine?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Hubert, I think?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Thou hast a perfect thought:

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I will upon all hazards well believe

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Thou art my friend, that know'st my tongue so well.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Who art thou?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Who thou wilt: and if thou please,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Thou mayst befriend me so much as to think

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I come one way of the Plantagenets.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Unkind remembrance! thou and eyeless night

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Have done me shame: brave soldier, pardon me,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: That any accent breaking from thy tongue

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Should 'scape the true acquaintance of mine ear.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Come, come; sans compliment, what news abroad?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Why, here walk I in the black brow of night,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: To find you out.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Brief, then; and what's the news?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: O, my sweet sir, news fitting to the night,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Black, fearful, comfortless and horrible.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Show me the very wound of this ill news:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I am no woman, I'll not swoon at it.

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: The king, I fear, is poison'd by a monk:

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: I left him almost speechless; and broke out

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: To acquaint you with this evil, that you might

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: The better arm you to the sudden time,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Than if you had at leisure known of this.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: How did he take it? who did taste to him?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: A monk, I tell you; a resolved villain,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Whose bowels suddenly burst out: the king

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Yet speaks and peradventure may recover.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Who didst thou leave to tend his majesty?

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: Why, know you not? the lords are all come back,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: And brought Prince Henry in their company;

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: At whose request the king hath pardon'd them,

speaker: HUBERT
text_entry: And they are all about his majesty.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Withhold thine indignation, mighty heaven,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And tempt us not to bear above our power!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I'll tell tree, Hubert, half my power this night,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Passing these flats, are taken by the tide;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: These Lincoln Washes have devoured them;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Myself, well mounted, hardly have escaped.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Away before: conduct me to the king;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I doubt he will be dead or ere I come.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exeunt

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: SCENE VII. The orchard in Swinstead Abbey.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Enter PRINCE HENRY, SALISBURY, and BIGOT

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: It is too late: the life of all his blood

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Is touch'd corruptibly, and his pure brain,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Which some suppose the soul's frail dwelling-house,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Doth by the idle comments that it makes

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Foretell the ending of mortality.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Enter PEMBROKE

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: His highness yet doth speak, and holds belief

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: That, being brought into the open air,

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: It would allay the burning quality

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Of that fell poison which assaileth him.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Let him be brought into the orchard here.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Doth he still rage?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exit BIGOT

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: He is more patient

speaker: PEMBROKE
text_entry: Than when you left him; even now he sung.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O vanity of sickness! fierce extremes

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: In their continuance will not feel themselves.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Death, having prey'd upon the outward parts,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Leaves them invisible, and his siege is now

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Against the mind, the which he pricks and wounds

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: With many legions of strange fantasies,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Whi ch, in their throng and press to that last hold,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Confound themselves. 'Tis strange that death

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: should sing.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I am the cygnet to this pale faint swan,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Who chants a doleful hymn to his own death,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And from the organ-pipe of frailty sings

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: His soul and body to their lasting rest.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Be of good comfort, prince; for you are born

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: To set a form upon that indigest

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Which he hath left so shapeless and so rude.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Enter Attendants, and BIGOT, carrying KING JOHN in a chair

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Ay, marry, now my soul hath elbow-room;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: It would not out at windows nor at doors.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: There is so hot a summer in my bosom,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: That all my bowels crumble up to dust:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: I am a scribbled form, drawn with a pen

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Upon a parchment, and against this fire

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Do I shrink up.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: How fares your majesty?

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Poison'd,--ill fare--dead, forsook, cast off:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And none of you will bid the winter come

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To thrust his icy fingers in my maw,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Nor let my kingdom's rivers take their course

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Through my burn'd bosom, nor entreat the north

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: To make his bleak winds kiss my parched lips

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And comfort me with cold. I do not ask you much,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: I beg cold comfort; and you are so strait

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And so ingrateful, you deny me that.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O that there were some virtue in my tears,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: That might relieve you!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The salt in them is hot.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Within me is a hell; and there the poison

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Is as a fiend confined to tyrannize

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: On unreprievable condemned blood.

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Enter the BASTARD

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O, I am scalded with my violent motion,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And spleen of speed to see your majesty!

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: O cousin, thou art come to set mine eye:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: The tackle of my heart is crack'd and burn'd,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And all the shrouds wherewith my life should sail

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Are turned to one thread, one little hair:

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: My heart hath one poor string to stay it by,

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: Which holds but till thy news be uttered;

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And then all this thou seest is but a clod

speaker: KING JOHN
text_entry: And module of confounded royalty.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The Dauphin is preparing hitherward,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Where heaven He knows how we shall answer him;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: For in a night the best part of my power,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As I upon advantage did remove,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Were in the Washes all unwarily

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Devoured by the unexpected flood.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: KING JOHN dies

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: You breathe these dead news in as dead an ear.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: My liege! my lord! but now a king, now thus.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Even so must I run on, and even so stop.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What surety of the world, what hope, what stay,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: When this was now a king, and now is clay?

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Art thou gone so? I do but stay behind

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To do the office for thee of revenge,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And then my soul shall wait on thee to heaven,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: As it on earth hath been thy servant still.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Now, now, you stars that move in your right spheres,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Where be your powers? show now your mended faiths,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And instantly return with me again,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To push destruction and perpetual shame

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Out of the weak door of our fainting land.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Straight let us seek, or straight we shall be sought;

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The Dauphin rages at our very heels.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: It seems you know not, then, so much as we:

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: The Cardinal Pandulph is within at rest,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Who half an hour since came from the Dauphin,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And brings from him such offers of our peace

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: As we with honour and respect may take,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: With purpose presently to leave this war.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: He will the rather do it when he sees

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Ourselves well sinewed to our defence.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: Nay, it is in a manner done already;

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: For many carriages he hath dispatch'd

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: To the sea-side, and put his cause and quarrel

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: To the disposing of the cardinal:

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: With whom yourself, myself and other lords,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: If you think meet, this afternoon will post

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: To consummate this business happily.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Let it be so: and you, my noble prince,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: With other princes that may best be spared,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Shall wait upon your father's funeral.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: At Worcester must his body be interr'd;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: For so he will'd it.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Thither shall it then:

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And happily may your sweet self put on

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: The lineal state and glory of the land!

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: To whom with all submission, on my knee

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: I do bequeath my faithful services

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And true subjection everlastingly.

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: And the like tender of our love we make,

speaker: SALISBURY
text_entry: To rest without a spot for evermore.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I have a kind soul that would give you thanks

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And knows not how to do it but with tears.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: O, let us pay the time but needful woe,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Since it hath been beforehand with our griefs.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: This England never did, nor never shall,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Lie at the proud foot of a conqueror,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: But when it first did help to wound itself.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Now these her princes are come home again,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Come the three corners of the world in arms,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: And we shall shock them. Nought shall make us rue,

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: If England to itself do rest but true.

speaker: BASTARD
text_entry: Exeunt
